• 3 = DM driving timeline/process and asking budget questions
ECONOMIC BUYER ENGAGEMENT (0.10)
• 0 = Missing from process
• 1 = Aware of initiative
• 2 = Discussed ROI / cost benefit
• 3 = Confirmed spend authority and timeline
PROBLEM URGENCY (0.15)
• 0 = “Just exploring” no clear pain
• 1 = General interest, minor inconvenience
• 2 = Clear pain affecting business metrics
• 3 = Must-solve-now with financial impact stated
BUYING PROCESS CLARITY (0.12)
• 0 = “We're just looking” no process
• 1 = General interest, no defined steps
• 2 = Defined evaluation steps and timeline
• 3 = Mutual action plan with specific dates and owners
STAKEHOLDER COVERAGE (0.10)
• 0 = Single point of contact only
• 1 = Multiple team members involved
• 2 = Cross-functional team engaged
• 3 = Full buying committee including executives
BUDGET AUTHORITY (0.10)
• 0 = No budget discussion
• 1 = Implied budget (company size suggests capacity)
• 2 = Budget range discussed or “approved for initiative”
• 3 = Specific budget confirmed and timeline for spend
TIMELINE SPECIFICITY (0.08)
• 0 = No timeline mentioned
• 1 = Vague references (“soon”, “next quarter”)
• 2 = Specific quarter or month mentioned
• 3 = Exact dates or “decision by [date]” stated

• 2 = No competitors mentioned, focused on solution
• 3 = Given unique access/demos beyond competitors
TECHNICAL FIT (0.05)

• 1 = General fit, some questions remain
• 2 = Good fit, minor customization needed
• 3 = Perfect fit, ready to implement

• Discovery = Initial calls, problem exploration, no defined process
• Evaluation = Product demos, multiple stakeholders, comparing options
• Validation = Technical deep dives, security reviews, reference calls
• Procurement = Contract negotiation, legal review, final approval

BEHAVIORAL MULTIPLIER TRIGGERS
Apply these after raw score calculation to reflect real buyer behavior.
POSITIVE MULTIPLIERS (Apply cumulatively, max 1.8×)

• × 1.4 = Executive sponsorship active in calls or approvals
• × 1.2 = Unique vendor access / early position in evaluation
NEGATIVE MULTIPLIERS (Apply cumulatively, min 0.4×)

• × 0.7 = Timeline remains vague / shifting without specific dates
• × 0.6 = Key Decision Maker or Economic Buyer absent from process
• × 0.8 = Active competitive bake-off or formal RFP detected
________________________________________
CONFIDENCE BENCHMARKS BY STAGE
These define defensible ranges for final Win Probability after normalization.
They anchor forecasts to real-world sales friction patterns and executive expectations.
• Discovery (10–35 %) → Early qualification, light commitment, low urgency.
• Evaluation (25–60 %) → Engaged buyers, demo completed, stakeholders aligned.
• Validation (50–85 %) → Technical fit confirmed, procurement in motion.

________________________________________
QUALITATIVE OVERRIDE FLAGS

• Timeline > 90 days but urgency claimed → Contradiction.

• Note absences: “No IT stakeholders present in technical discussion.”

1.	Score each factor 0–3 based on transcript evidence.
2.	Weighted contribution = (Score ÷ 3) × Weight.
3.	Sum weighted contributions = Raw Score %.
4.	Apply stage-based modifiers.
5.	Apply behavioral multipliers.
6.	Normalize within stage confidence range.
